heading: aol profits rise
subheading: america online beats analysts' earnings expectations with a 170 percent profit increase in its latest quarter. also: amazon.com reports another loss ... sgi releases earnings.
author: wired news report
text: america online on wednesday reported fourth-quarter profits grew 170 percent to us$156 million, nudging ahead of wall street's earnings expectations, which were tempered by the seasonal softness in online services use during spring and summer. fully taxed operating income for the fourth quarter ended 30 june was $156 million, or 13 cents per share -- excluding charges to cover the costs of several acquisitions -- compared to earnings of $58 million in the year-ago quarter.fourth-quarter revenues rose to $1.4 billion, 46 percent above the fiscal year ending in june 1998. advertising, commerce, and other revenues reached $306 million, up 87 percent from a year ago. subscriptions from users of its 17.6 million-member aol service and 2 million-member compuserve service, still the company's revenue mainstay, grew 39 percent to $943 million.crossing a key symbolic milestone, america online's (aol) fiscal 1999 year advertising, commerce, and other revenues totaled $1 billion, an 84 percent increase over fiscal 1998.the aol service added 755,000 new members in the fourth quarter, on the low side of wall street hopes, which aol officials said reflected softness in european growth. aol has faced stiff competition in europe from new "free" internet services.--amazon reports a loss: online retailing giant amazon.com on wednesday reported losses deepened sharply in its latest quarter, as expected. revenues, bolstered in part by the site's new auction business, nearly tripled.the seattle-based internet company also said its board of directors approved a two-for-one stock split effective 1 september for shareholders of record as of 12 august.for the second quarter ended 30 june, amazon.com (amzn) reported a pro forma net loss of us$82.8 million, or 51 cents per share, compared with a net loss of $17 million, or 12 cents per share, a year earlier. net sales rose 171 percent to $314.4 million from $116 million a year earlier.the results were in line with estimates of wall street analysts who on average expected a net loss of 51 cents a share, according to first call.amazon.com had disclosed in april that it expected losses to deepen as it stepped up its pace of investments and acquisitions, and chief executive officer jeff bezos said in a statement that for the rest of the year the company would continue to invest more heavily than it had in the past.the company also said that cumulative customer accounts, including auction bidders and sellers, had risen to 10.7 million as of 30 june, up 2.3 million in the quarter and compared with 3.3 million a year earlier.--sgi reports earnings: silicon graphics (sgi) said wednesday that revenue in its fiscal fourth quarter, which ended 30 june, rose to us$829 million, compared with $774 million in the same quarter a year ago.the company reported a net profit for the fourth quarter, including the company's gain on the secondary offering of shares of its mips technologies subsidiary, of $158 million. excluding the mips gain, the company's net income would have been $22 million, or 12 cents per share.revenue for fiscal 1999 was $2.7 billion, compared with $3.1 billion for fiscal 1998.
